archetypedescription.p: The plane where the fey lords rule, known by many names, lies close to the mortal realms. In some places, so close, that these planes are frequently congruent and one can easily pass from one plane to the other. One such place is the Nebelwald forest north of Aquilonia. Here lies the kingdom of the High Elves, an archaic race of fey origins.

At the dawn of time the original elves were the get of humans living near the Nebelwald and summer lords, fey nobles, crossing into the mortal realms for their own amusements. Shunned by both humans and fey, the elves congregated in the Nebelwald, under the ostensible protection of the fey, there they nursed their resentment of the peoples who had treated them so, and grew strong.

The magical aptitude of the High Elves, combined with their discipline and keen intellect allowed the Elvin kingdom to flourish. At the height of their power the High Elves ruled a large portion of the continent and many kingdoms of men where little more than client states, supplicant to the High King in the Weald.

All things end, and the hegemony of the elves was no exception. The Elves were always over-proud, and their High King Aranthir was the peer of the elves in all things, including hubris. One day a minor fey lord, captured on some escapade, was brought before the King. The lordlet refused to bend the knee before the king and laughed when ordered to do so. The King, intoxicated by his own haughty spirit had the lordlet beheaded for his impudence.

No one at the time realized that this event marked the zenith of the power of the high elves, nor how quickly would they fall from grace. The Fey queen regarded the execution as a personal slight, and after a few failed attempts by the elves to placate her, the seelie array descended upon the High Elves, and before the new moon had waxed the serried ranks of the elfin host lay scattered like wheat after harvest. The supplicant kingdoms of the humans abandoned them, and the power of the High Elf kingdom was brought low for all times.

Presently, the High Elves have adopted an isolationist diplomatic policy striving to avoid conflict. Protected to the north by the great mountains of Fafnirs Tusks, and to the south by the decaying remnants of the Aquilonian empire this policy has been largely successful.

Elven Scions is the name given to the second and third sons and daughters of noble elfin families with comparatively little magic talent, and few prospects. Certain members of Elf society feel that this lack of magical talent is due to the individuals being too human and not fey enough. Blood purists quietly resent these individuals and fear that they weaken the magical power of future generations of the elvish nation, further claiming that their humanity makes them quick to anger, being little more than aggressive beasts.

Due to the fractuous presence of the Scions in the Elven courts, lack of inheritance or gainful employ these supernumerary youths are often encouraged to stay away from the courts by providing them with make-work jobs far afield. Trouble makers are sometimes sent away by fiat. While others leave their homes out of a sense of ennui, or in search of opportunity for advancement elsewhere.

Trained by a range of tutors in an array of fields from a young age, an Elven Scion may be a troublemaker, wanderer, diplomant, poet, champion, or spy, and is very often may of the above. When abroad they are expected to act as the eyes and ears of the elvish courts, as agents that protect and project Elvish power in the world, and to act in the best interests of the Elvish Courts.

archetypeinitialabilities.p: All elven scions start with the following skills: ✱sword.strike_2, ✱physical.dodge_2, ✱archery.shoot_2, ✱language.aquilonian_2, ✱language.sylvan_4, ✱special.fey_resilience_1, ✱social.etiquette[Elven]_3, ✱luck.nick_of_time_1, ✱physical.flee_3, ✱enchantment.lore_1, ✱enchantment.zoolingualism_1 and ✱arcana.lore_1. Two of ✱physical.jump_2, ✱physical.listen_2, or ✱physical.climb_2. Three of ✱skulduggery.concealment_2, ✱skulduggery.ropecraft_2, ✱skulduggery.sneak_2, ✱skulduggery.trap_work_2 or ✱transport.horse_riding_2. Two of ✱wilderness.hunting_2, ✱wilderness.scout_2, ✱wilderness.stealth_2, ✱wilderness.survivalism_2, ✱wilderness.tracking_2. Gain ✱lore.book_learning_1 and two of ✱lore.history_2, ✱lore.natural_history_2, ✱lore.politics[Aquillonia]_2, ✱lore.antiquarian_2. Choose one of ✱enchantment.auri_fames_1 and ✱arcana.ignis_1, ✱arcana.cloak_of_shadows_2 and ✱enchantment.speak_with_birds_1, or ✱enchantment.glamour_1 and ✱arcana.true_sight_1. Choose one of ✱arts.singing_2, ✱arts.dance_2, ✱arts.strings_2. Choose two of ✱language.merovingian_2, ✱language.occitan_2, ✱language.poitevin_2, or ✱language.leonese_2.

archetype.aspectexamples: Chivalry is not dead. Glory is forever. When you kill a man it costs nothing to be polite. Dark family secret that no-one must know. The clothes maketh the man. From a noble family, now disgraced. Maths is hard. How can I resist? Everything Has a Price.
